value.title: Custom sort order for axis, columns, legends.... in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do I sort och change the default order for columns, axis, legends in Power BI?  I get this question all the time, and although I have already explained it in other videos, I don't have a specific video for it and your questions hint me that is needed.  So here it is, In this video we are going to

value.title: Dataflows and power query - November 2020 update
value.excerpt: Have you seen the new and upcoming features released on November 2020 for Dataflows and Power Query? In today's video, I will go through them so you stay up to date:  00:00 Intro 00:24 New Diagram view 01:36 New schema view 02:16 Add column from example  02:20 Add web from example 03:13 Fuzzy grouping

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #116: Time intelligence with Fiscal Years
value.excerpt: I have previously shown you how to work with time intelligence functions using a standard calendar, but how do you do it with Fiscal Calendars? value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.
